meanings.definition: The act of putting something in the wrong place.
meanings.sent1: Her misplacement of the keys caused her to be late for work.
meanings.sent2: The misplacement of the book led to hours of searching.
meanings.sent3: The misplacement of the remote control made the family play a game of 'find the remote'.
meanings.sent4: His misplacement of trust in the wrong person resulted in betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The misplacement of the treasure map added an unexpected twist to the adventure.

meanings.definition: The state of being in the wrong place.
meanings.sent1: The misplacement of the vase on the edge of the table made her nervous.
meanings.sent2: The misplacement of the sign confused the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The misplacement of the cat in the dog's bed created a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: His misplacement in the wrong class caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent5: The misplacement of the stars in the sky made the constellation unrecognizable.
